intro: Anaphalis nubigena, commonly known as the cloud-like fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and fluffy, white capitula that resemble clouds, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Anaphalis nubigena thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine soils. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitats.
